result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth L. Purdy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim due within 30 days.  Defendant shall have counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Court ordered civil judgments be entered for the unpaid court costs and restitution.  The unpaid court costs are to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning October 1, 2018.

The jail sentence shall begin immediately.  
The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Any Other Sentence

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kenneth L. Purdy in court by phone from Jackson Correctional with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties have agreed upon an amended figure for restitution.  The stipulation is that restitution with the surcharge is $1,251.78 the restitution is joint and several.  Court will accept the restitution figure.  Attorney Tlusty indicated that an amended restitution summary was filed.  - rt
and Certificate of Appearance for J.A.S.
Restitution Summary
In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing
Restitution hearing at 10-21-2015 09:15 am
Restitution Summary
of J.S.

Defendant Kenneth L. Purdy in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim notification has been complied.  Court amends count 1 to misdemeanor theft  as a repeater- 943.20(1)(a).  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to the amended charge.  Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders withheld sentence probation for one year with conditions of court costs; DNA surcharge; restitution joint and several; letter of apology to the victim due within 30 days; 30 hours of community service; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  3 days sentence credit.  Attorney Laufenberg requested that the signature bond that was revoked be forgiven.  The court ordered that the $4,000.00 revoked bond be reduced to $2,000.00.  Defendant shall pay $25.00 a month towards the bond revocation due within 30 days of release.  Everything that he is paying to the Clerk's office is on one payment plan.  - rt
Days Credit Worksheet

Ad Prosequendum
